title: Rob Lowe is sizzling hot in firefighter uniform for 9-1-1: Lonestar
text:
Cue slow motion segment (Picture: Splashnews.com)

Rob Lowe brought the heat while wearing a firefighter costume on set for his new series 911: Lone Star.

The actor looked like he meant business with his uniform while he portrayed a man who’s struggling to balance saving people and solving the problems in his own life.

The series is a spin-off 2018’s 911, created by Ryan Murphy and Brad Falchuk blessing us with their creative storylines, which was cancelled after only two episodes.

Now that Rob Lowe’s in it, there’s no way it can be cancelled.

‘The beauty of having a hit drama like 911 from the genius minds of Ryan Murphy, Brad Falchuk and Tim Minear is it allows you to explore thrilling stories as told through an array of distinctive characters,’ said Fox Entertainment president Michael Thorn.

‘In 911: Lone Star, they’ve given us a special opportunity to expand the franchise into new territory – literally and figuratively – and we’re thrilled to have the incomparable Rob Lowe headline this new iteration when it joins our schedule next season.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

Ryan Murphy and Brad Falchuk are best known for their work on American Horror Story, Glee, Pose, American Crime Story and basically every show that is great at being over the top and wild.

And what’s over the top and wild without Rob there to make everything better.

Saving kittens from trees is what he does best (Picture: SplashNews.com)

Just your friendly neighbourhood firefighter, waiting to do things in slow motion (Picture: SplashNews.com)

Liv Tyler and Charlize Theron are set to be in the crime series, along with Brian Michael Smith who will play a transgender character.

Natacha Karam, Rafael Silva and Julian Works will also be series regulars.

If the show goes to plan, Ryan and Brad would be able to expand the series into a larger franchise akin to Dick Wolf’s Chicago.

Anyone else ready for endless hours of Rob in uniform saving people from fires with dramatic montages?

We are.
